CHAPTER 5 
AI SYSTEM
 
62 
 
CHAPTER 5 AI SYSTEM 
 
 
Developing machine learning models for handwriting recognition 
involves several key stages. Initially, a suitable dataset is collected and 
prepared, including data cleaning, labeling, and augmentation to 
enhance generalization. Next, various model architectures are tested to 
identify the best fit for the task, optimizing configurations and 
hyperparameters. Training the model is an iterative process requiring 
careful tuning and validation. Techniques like transfer learning can 
further improve performance by leveraging pre-trained models. 
Throughout development, performance metrics are continually 
evaluated to ensure the model meets accuracy and reliability standards 
and Figure 5.1 [77] shows the relation between the training data and the 
model. 
 
 
Figure 5.1: Model Development Process 
 
5.1 Data Collection & Preparation 
 
 
Developing a robust handwriting recognition model begins with 
the meticulous collection and preparation of a comprehensive dataset. 
This process involves curating a diverse array of samples that
